snippet: The seven members of the Afghanistan Investment Support Agency said there was rampant nepotism, corruption and mismanagement in the organization.
abstract: Seven members of the Afghanistan Investment Support Agency, group that promotes investment in the country, resign, saying there is rampant nepotism, corruption and mismanagement within the organization; departures come just days after Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai assures the United States and international donors that he is serious about fighting corruption.

byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

lead_paragraph: The seven members of the Afghanistan Investment Support Agency said there was rampant nepotism, corruption and mismanagement in the organization.

headline.seo: 7 Officials in Afghan Investment Agency Quit in Protest
headline.main: 7 Officials in Afghan Investment Agency Quit, Protesting Graft
headline.print_headline: 7 Officials in Afghan Investment Agency Quit, Protesting Graft
